thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Cohen Bramall set to play big role in Arsenal’s senior team despite joining from non-league football
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Cohen Bramall set to play big role in Arsenal’s senior team despite joining from non-league football

author: achapman
title: Arsenal transfer news: Cohen Bramall set to play big role in Arsenal’s senior team despite joining from non-league football
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments COHEN BRAMALL could feature for Arsenal’s first team this season ahead of his imminent move from Hednesford Town. 
Gunners fans have been expecting fresh faces to support their title bid this month. ⚽️ A photo posted by Cohen Bramall (@cohen_bramall) on Aug 23, 2016 at 7:14am PDT 
But not many would have put their money on a 20-year-old left-back from non-league. Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Bramall is expected to cost just £40,000 and has agreed a two-year contract after meeting his future teammates. 
But anyone thinking he’s just one for the future should think again, with the Daily Star claiming to have a contact who knows otherwise. A photo posted by Cohen Bramall (@cohen_bramall) on Jun 5, 2016 at 8:53am PDT Bournemouth 3 Arsenal 3: Olivier Giroud scores injury-time equaliser 
The 'well-placed' source said: “Arsenal fans will be wondering ‘why are we signing someone from non-league? Well, it’s not as simple as saying he’s from non-league so mustn’t be what we want. 
“Nacho Monreal and Kieran Gibbs are ahead of him but there aren’t a load of left-sided players at the club. Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport's daily LIVE blog Related Stories Olivier Giroud's celebration epitomised everything wrong with Arsenal's mentality under Arsene Wenger 'IF YOU DON'T LOSE YOU DON'T GROW' Defiant Hector Bellerin quotes beaten UFC star after 'worst game of his career' Transfers live All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window GUNNING FOR EACH OTHER
